name: The Dodge-lympics
description:
The controls for each player are displayed on-screen.
The UI is overlapping, but the game is completely playable.

Welcome to the arena! In this 2-player game, you take turns shooting each other. The last one left standing wins!

The players will take turns attacking and defending. One player will be attacking, and the other one will be defending.

The attacker is also able to lightly control it after firing with left&right. After a determined amount of shots, the players switch roles. After a determined amount of rounds, the game ends. Whoever has the most points wins.

By random chance, a random letter will show up on screen with a red or blue color.
If either player hits the key, the player with the opposite color of the key will be sabotaged. 

If a player hits the space bar, then it will be destroyed and prevent the opposition from getting any help. (Essentially, hit your own color, and destroy your opposite color.)

If the key was for the attacker, the defender will be  slower for a limited time.
If the key was for the defender, the attacker will be unable to control their ball.

The players can activate a superpower with their charge meter. Once the charge is filled, the effect is activated automatically.

When attacking, the charge meter can be filled if the attack hits a powerup (which is in a random position on the field) on it's way to the target. 
When defending, the charge meter can be filled if the attack barely hit the defender. 

The attacker's charge ability will make the next shot much faster, and the shot can be controlled better.
The defender's ability will make the defender automatically dodge the next shot.

Project for my Game Programming 2 Class.
